A subset $ B$ of the set of integers from $ 1$ to $ 100$, inclusive, has the property that no two elements of $ B$ sum to $ 125$. What is the maximum possible number of elements in $ B$?\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 50\qquad 
\textbf{(B)}\ 51\qquad 
\textbf{(C)}\ 62\qquad 
\textbf{(D)}\ 65\qquad 
\textbf{(E)}\ 68$
